snippet: Thirteen clinics across Texas were forced to stop performing abortions because they did not meet the standards of a hospital-style surgery center, as now mandated by law.
abstract: Staff and patients at 13 clinics across Texas that were forced to stop performing abortions under new law struggle to reassess how and where they can receive procedure; federal appeals court had ruled that all clinics in state must meet building and staffing standards of hospital-style surgery center.

byline.original: By LAURA TILLMAN and ERIK ECKHOLM

lead_paragraph: Thirteen clinics across Texas were forced to stop performing abortions because they did not meet the standards of a hospital-style surgery center, as now mandated by law.

headline.main: Texas Women Forced to Reassess After New Ruling on Abortions
headline.print_headline: Texas Women Forced to Reassess After New Ruling on Abortions
